It is subtitled. BnB Beatles Depot

Title: Astral City: A Spiritual Journey

reviewText: I was delightfully surprised by this film. I cried tears of joy at the end.The screenplay, acting, set design, and special effects worked well together. The editing was excellent and the story flows well.The most marvelous part of the film for me was the subjective experience. I suspect that is somewhat impossible not to consider one's own life while enjoying this film. By the end of Act 1, I was was somewhat stunned at how selfishly I have lived my life thus far. By the end of Act 3, I felt as if my whole life had been given a giant hug, and I was filled with a non-judgmental awareness of living with more kindness and understanding towards myself and others.I will gladly recommend this film to my friends and family. It is a beautiful combination of art, entertainment, and love. A rare gem.
summary: Beautiful, uplifting, lovingly affects the heart
Title: Astral City: A Spiritual Journey

reviewText: Thought-provoking film, the story was very well told. A doctor who is stern and austere on Earth dies and "wakes up" in a place called "our home." This place is a spiritual realm that sits right above Earth. He has an intense awakening in his search for spiritual truth. There are lessons to learn in this place and realizations to come to that will help him have peace so that he may move forward. The surroundings are visually striking and I really enjoyed this movie.
summary: Inspirational Journey in search of Peace and Love
Title: Astral City: A Spiritual Journey

reviewText: It doesn't take long to realize that man has distorted God's Word in this movie and gone into science fiction

reviewText: I can't say enough good about this film.  It is an excellent depiction of one soul's journey in the afterlife as revealed to a medium who wrote the book about his experiences, and now it is a film.  I dreaded watching something in another language and having to read subtitles, but it was worth it!

reviewText: If you've seen all those Hollywood movies about reincarnation, spiritualism and Buddhism will be amazed by this movie. If you have an aversion to this kind of issue because he had a loaded spiritual formation of fear, it is also time to see this DVD. The author of this story was a semi-literate man who wrote over 400 books, all of them dictated by spiritual beings: Chico Xavier. His books are read both in and outside Brazil by people of all religions because they are not about religion as we know it. the movie shows different characters who find themselves living after death and then realize that there is an eternal life hereafter. It is beautiful and comforting. Gives a new direction in our life. You will want to give a copy of this movie to all your friends and relatives. Probably you will save one for yourself...
summary: There is life after life without drama
Title: Astral City: A Spiritual Journey

reviewText: An interesting look on what life is like and a different twist on the directions we take in life and how that affects what comes next.
Title: Astral City: A Spiritual Journey

reviewText: This film is pretty old and is based on even older source material.  A "psychic" in South America wrote quite a lot of books; this is a film distillation.  One has to remember the context (Brazil, about 4 years before the outbreak of World War I).  The real life "psychic" was Francisco Xavier.  The movie depicts a story of a Brazilian physician with a mediocre life (in good-bad terms) who dies and finds himself in the spiritual realms.The belief system depicted here includes the idea of reincarnation.  I don't personally subscribe to that, but many do.  I found some elements of the concept of afterlife credible.  If you are not interested in any such speculation then you had better skip this altogether.  Otherwise, you'll find a lot of material you can compare to other accounts.
Title: Astral City: A Spiritual Journey

reviewText: I really enjoyed and related to this movie very much. I at first though that becasue it was sub titled in English that it would be a painful experience. How wrong I was. Becasue I had to watch and read the impact and values of the movie were easill retained and it has changed my thinking in some aspects about the after this world and confirmed many of my already held beliefs. I rated this 5 star becasue anyone who is sincerely interested in this aspect of life will benifit from viewing. To those who wish to just mock or dont believe then keep that and thise thoughts to yourself, they are unhelpful to those that are truley seeking the truth in their life journey. Well done and logical.

reviewText: I had no idea what this really was when I bought it. A movie made in Brazil with sub-titles, as it turned out but; with wonderful production values and a remarkable story based upon the novel by Chico Xavier. (Books available on amazon.com) Even if you don't believe in an Afterlife, this movie will certainly provoke thought and consideration in a that direction. Life, death, and the next world. All mysteries that we humans want to unravel. Astral City: A Spritual Journey might just have those answers.
Title: Astral City: A Spiritual Journey

reviewText: It was simply awesome. From its opening credits to the end, it was a delight to watch and gave me something to ponder at every moment.
Title: Astral City: A Spiritual Journey

reviewText: In a world that's becoming smaller every day, in which many people are creating their own spiritual belief systems out of pieces of many different religions (Christianity, Islam, Judaism, Buddhism, Yoga, Hinduism, etc.), this film represents a composite of what various religious philosophies say about the afterlife and indeed, the meaning of life.  There's a kind of Hell for those who have not lived up to their spiritual promise in life, but you can escape Hell and enter a kind of Purgatory, a pleasant place where you go to do penance for at least some of your bad karma and learn from others in a similar situation.  It's kind of a spiritual holding pen where you wait for your next life to begin, and then you return to Planet Earth and start over again, hopefully evolving even further spiritually.  So where is Heaven, and what's it like?  I suspect it's where and when you become reunited with the Universe after your reincarnations are complete.  Some viewers might thing Heaven is the Astral City, but I don't think so.  Heaven really wasn't covered in this film. Heaven is the end of karma.This could have been just some silly New Age piece of fluff, but "Astral City" was filmed beautifully, had good actors and intelligent dialogue, and was quite believable. None of us knows what happens after death, if anything, but this film, based on the visions of a real-life psychic, could offer some clues.
summary: Nifty amalgam of Eastern and Western ideas about the afterlife
Title: Astral City: A Spiritual Journey

reviewText: seeing the method of healing he was shown on the other side was Awesome!. . . . . . .
Title: Astral City: A Spiritual Journey

reviewText: I have been interested in spirit matters for some time now and decided to give this a try. Boy, was I ever surprised. I blew me away to the point where I started reading material on spiritism, including the book upon which this film is based. I found myself having to rewind it at times to soak in what was being said.This film deals with the post-death experiences of a physician who had led a less-than-stellar life on Earth and now had to become worthy of entry into the next realm of existence by turning away from the materialistic toward the spiritual. Once this is accomplished, his journeys through the colony that prepares souls for reincarnation or to move on to higher planes is absorbing and thought-provoking. While the book is steeped in the Judeo-Christian mindset, it is minimized in the film and its lessons can apply to anyone, regardless of religion.If you are interested in "progressing" in your spiritual development, I would highly recommend that you watch this film. Even if you're not, it will give you a lot to think about.
Title: Astral City: A Spiritual Journey

reviewText: Have been into study of the afterlife my entire life (over a half century!), and this movie I would rate as being at least 95% accurate as I know it and have experienced it myself (I was a Spiritualist minister and medium before I became disabled). Most interesting concept besides forgiveness, and our duty to help others, and that we are all essentially the same and loved but at different levels of spiritual development, is that of "balance" and that when the "body temple" is abused, there is a karmic connection that must be paid, in this case in a type of purgatory situation; however, when sincere prayer and help is requested from the heart, help is always available. I do believe that "gluttony" is listed as one of the 7 deadly sins, however, I never thought of these actions as being "suicidal". Yet, I have said to an friend, who abuses pain medications with alcohol, that she must have a "death wish", her reply being, "you have to die of something". In that respect, I can see why it would be considered a "suicide". I enjoyed the use of colored lights for healing, electro-magnetic healing and water charging, the fact that the doctor's mother was on a higher plane and his father on a lower one and it is true that those from a higher vibrational plane can lower their vibrations to visit those on lower levels but not the other way around. I learned a lesson myself, sort of a spoiler here: when the doctor was working on the other side, he wanted to keep working, and the spiritual nurse replied in so many words that all good workers must rest, as it's the quality of the work! I have always been a Type A and pushed myself way beyond my limits when doing gymnastics, dance, and working in the medical field with patients, so that line really got my attention. I also know there is a record of everything we have every said, thought, or done, and that the deceased can pick up our thoughts and prayers, and the Catholics have got it so right-please pray for those that have recently crossed over, they need all the help they can to adjust to the other side. I also know that communication is done through thought, at least once you're adjusted. However, from what I saw in the movie, it still seemed to be a somewhat lower plane, and am wondering if the deceased doctor that has channeled so many books has real knowledge of the higher planes if he is still residing on that vibrationial plane? I plan to buy the movie. Told one of my doctors about it and he was anticipating watching it soon. The quality of the picture is great. Only suggestion I have, is I wish that you could pause and read the subtitles, when you pause, the subtitles are partially covered so therefore unreadable (I have to have subtitles, and am very disappointed that even though foreign films are my favorite, that subtitles are not available on other movies-surprised the ADA has not filed a complaint on that!).
summary: Watched it again the next day
Title: Astral City: A Spiritual Journey

reviewText: Astral City is a wonderfully crafted story about a man who dies, then realizes what is really important about life. He learns about how to navigate the afterlife, and that he's powerless, whereas once he was powerful. I thought this was a very thought provoking movie. You would have to be a piece of wood not to get some meaning out of it. Lookout though, if you don't like subtitles and listening to portuguese, then think twice about getting this flick. I didn't mind the subtitles at all, and got just as much out of the movie as if it had been in english. Now the most interesting part of this movie, is that the story was channelled through a medium. If you believe in that kind of thing. (Not that there's anything wrong with it, if you don't). This was a great  addition to my "spiritual/metaphysical" library.
summary: Not for everyone, but I loved it!
Title: Astral City: A Spiritual Journey

Title: Astral City: A Spiritual Journey

reviewText: I confess that I found out about Astral City: A Spiritual Journey on Amazon Canada and had a chance to watch it on Hulu. Astral City: A Spiritual Journey is based on a 1944 book titled Nosso Lar by the late Brazilian author Chico Xavier.  I have already watched it twice and intend to eventually purchase the dvd. One of the reasons being is because the film beautifully depicts how a spirit can still grow and change for the positive in the spirit realm. I also like how the narrator (who also plays one of the lead parts in the film) pours his heart in playing a soul who candidly describes both the good and challenging aspects of returning to the true spiritual home.  The characters speak in what I am guessing to be the Portuguese language, but there are English subtitles included in the movie.  This movie has definitely piqued my interest in eventually checking out one of the books by Chico Xavier (sometime within the next  year). Astral City: A Spiritual Journey is best for those who like watching movies set in benevolent spirit realms. More information about the movie can be accessed from Bob Olson’s AfterlifeTVdotcom website (under the November 29, 2011 article of Does Life Continue After Death).
summary: A Soul’s Journey Towards Even Greater Spiritual Growth
Title: Astral City: A Spiritual Journey

reviewText: Whether the reality after life depicted is "accurate" or not, I think this is a good movie, and inspiring.  I don't know whether there's much point in saying ***SPOILER ALERT*** because ALL the reviews are spilling the beans, but what I appreciated so much was the subtlety.  Whatever spiritual persuasion you may be, the lessons the Doctor learned were subtle in the extreme.  Petty irritations, ego and pride, concern about status and outward appearances were shown in small, seemingly insignificant yet profound ways.  For example, in one scene in life the Doctor is annoyed, sigh, but reluctantly sees a woman and her husband at the end of the day without an appointment, SUCH an imposition.  In the afterlife, he avoids the woman again.  Later he learns this woman was so grateful to him for helping her husband that she prayed for him (with utter selflessness), and thanks to that single prayer he was plucked from hellish oblivion and given the chance to repent, be rehabilitated.Whatever your spiritual persuasion, whether the film is "true" or not, the stages in the Doctor's spiritual journey are lessons everyone should learn in order to be a better human being and a healthy, happy person, here and now (sort of likeGroundhog Day, come to think of it).  A beautiful film, beautifully filmed, touching, inspiring and thought-provoking, you won't soon forget it.  Bravo!P.S.  Thematically, this reminds me of another film I saw recently (LOVED it) that dealt with some of the same issues (e.g., life after death, transformation, the nature of love) though more whimsically and with even greater subtlety, one of the best films I've seen in a LONG while:Dean Spanley.
Title: Astral City: A Spiritual Journey

reviewText: This was a very very nice movie but I only gave it 4 stars because it was slow moving.It had a brilliant story line with a nice moral punch to it.  I highly recommend the viewingof this one!
Title: Astral City: A Spiritual Journey

reviewText: Although the subtitles may throw some off, I particularly like to watch foreign language movies with subtitles. I feel like I get a more authentic experience.The way the storyline unfolds drew me in and it began to get me questioning my own life and how I have done things and how easy it is to be blinded by the distractions of this world. Astral City explores the possible implications of Spiritual deafness/blindness.I found the movie a welcome "pause to refresh" on the path in my own spiritual journey, as I try to balance the material world and spiritual world. I am bombarded by messages each day to " do this" or "buy that" and am caught up in the turning wheels of the modern society. Astral City is successful at breaking through this mirage.
summary: Wow! - moving story and beautiful scenery
Title: Astral City: A Spiritual Journey
